name: places/ChIJT4XSpd5YwokR29r5feIuc8E
formattedAddress: 281 W Main St, New York, NY 10044, USA
adrFormatAddress: 281 W Main St, New York, NY 10044-0056, USA

originalText.text: Terrible place for people new to tennis or people who have questions. The staff makes you feel like you should be happy that they even allow you to pay and take classes there. I wish i listened to the other reviews. Stay away at all costs. I know what you are thinking "this won't happen to me" ... IT WILL. There are much better locations elsewhere in NYC.

text.text: Terrible place for people new to tennis or people who have questions. The staff makes you feel like you should be happy that they even allow you to pay and take classes there. I wish i listened to the other reviews. Stay away at all costs. I know what you are thinking "this won't happen to me" ... IT WILL. There are much better locations elsewhere in NYC.

originalText.text: Clean facility with many indoor, hard courts. The courts are har-tru. The back 4 courts are not well ventilated so it gets pretty hot and humid. There’s a pretty large changing room. The staff at the check in counter were nice; however, when I had to register, their system wasn’t functioning properly. The manager, from maybe 5 meters from the check in counter, kept yelling at me like it was my fault that my registration wasn’t working. After a few more attempts, I turned the ipad around and showed her I wasn’t the issue. She then yelled at the girls at the front that they were doing something wrong. No apology for yelling at me. The place is conveniently close to subway lines and the tram, but the manager is unprofessional and rude. After reading the other reviews, I'm surprised the same lady has been kept as manager. I find that pretty disgusting and a sign that senior execs don't carry about customer service.

originalText.text: Members have access to 12 HarTru tennis courts that are heated and air-conditioned for comfortable year-round play.

text.text: Members have access to 12 HarTru tennis courts that are heated and air-conditioned for comfortable year-round play.

originalText.text: Great Facility and Location.  Friendly Reception.  Will come again.

text.text: Great Facility and Location.  Friendly Reception.  Will come again.

originalText.text:
Avoid at all costs, especially if you’re a beginner looking to try out tennis through their bulk classes. They will promise one thing on their newsletters and website and deliver a different service without even so much as acknowledging their inconsistencies and false marketing. Pam, the general manager of this establishment, has such a rude, nasty, and condescending attitude that I was appalled to realize this was who I was paying my money to. You will feel especially unwelcome if you are a POC — she hurled hurtful stereotypes against my Black partner that were too stunningly ignorant to even be offended by. I would ask for a refund for all my past classes if I had known this is how they treat and think of their customers.

There are way too many tennis clubs in the city with better facilities, customer service, and not to mention pricing to come to this place. Please do yourself a favor and stay away.
